intro: Neoporteria totoralensis var. carrizalensis, commonly known as the Carrizalensis neoporteria, is a rare plant species native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low precipitation. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
